<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketGetInfo:
```c
int32 OS_SocketGetInfo(osal_id_t sock_id, OS_socket_prop_t *sock_prop)
{
    OS_common_record_t *record;
    OS_object_token_t   token;
    int32               return_code;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(sock_prop);

    memset(sock_prop, 0, sizeof(OS_socket_prop_t));

    /* Check Parameters */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, sock_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_global_stream_table, token);

        strncpy(sock_prop->name, record->name_entry, sizeof(sock_prop->name) - 1);
        sock_prop->creator = record->creator;
        return_code        = OS_SocketGetInfo_Impl(&token, sock_prop);

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_SocketGetInfo:
typedef struct
{
    char      name[OS_MAX_API_NAME]; /**< @brief Name of the socket */
    osal_id_t creator;               /**< @brief OSAL TaskID which opened the socket */
} OS_socket_prop_t
...
typedef struct OS_common_record OS_common_record_t
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
strncpy(sock_prop->name, record->name_entry, sizeof(sock_prop->name) - 1);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 21.17 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated provided the source buffer is at least as large as the destination size. The code calls strncpy(sock_prop->name, record->name_entry, sizeof(sock_prop->name) - 1) after memset(sock_prop,0,sizeof(*sock_prop)), so: (1) the destination will not be written beyond its bounds (the call limits copies to sizeof(name)-1 and the final byte remains 0 from the earlier memset, ensuring a NUL terminator), and (2) no overflow of dest occurs. However, a violation scenario exists if record->name_entry does not refer to an object at least sizeof(sock_prop->name)-1 bytes long (for example, if it is a pointer to a smaller buffer or an unterminated string whose enclosing object is smaller than the requested copy length). In that case strncpy may read beyond the source object’s bounds and Rule 21.17 would be violated.
